questions.question: 1. What do you mean by an array?

answers.a: A container of unique elements of similar types
answers.b: Data structure having linear access time
answers.c: Data structure containing elements located in various locations memory which may or may not be contiguous
answers.d: Data structure containing elements of similar types in contiguous storage

explanations.a: Elements in an array may or may not be unique.
explanations.b: Access time in an array is constant, not linear.
explanations.c: Array always stores its elements in contiguous memory locations.

questions.question: 2. If for large inputs, X is a better choice than Y, then:

answers.a: Y is asymptotically more efficient than X
answers.b: X is asymptotically more efficient than Y
answers.c: X and Y are equivalently efficient

explanations.a: Incorrect, Y cannot be more efficient as X is a better choice
explanations.b: Since X is asymptotically more efficient than Y, hence X will perform better in case of large inputs
explanations.c: Since X is getting preferred, hence X and Y cannot be equivalent

questions.question: 3. Which is one of the fastest sorting algorithms?

explanations.a: Time complexity of bogo sort is O(n*n!) making it one of the worst sorting algorithm
explanations.b: Time complexity of merge sort in O(n log n) which is one of the best
explanations.c: Time complexity of cocktail sort is O(n^2) which is slower than the fastest one

questions.question: 4. Which data structure stores a collection of disjoint sets?

explanations.a: Stack stores data in LIFO order, but does not identifies disjoint sets
explanations.b: This is not a data structure
explanations.c: Union Find, also known as Merge Find, stores the disjoint sets, and is helpful for identifying them
explanations.d: Heap does not identifies disjoint sets

questions.question: Which of the following is correct?

answers.a: Graphs cannot have cycles, but trees can
answers.b: Trees cannot have cycles, but graphs can
answers.c: Both trees and graphs can have cycles
answers.d: Neither tree nor graphs can have cycles

explanations.b: A tree is a special case of graph with no cycles
